name: dezufnocosem
text: i could go for some nice liquid banjo right about now

name: centipede_damascus
text: So Lyle can't read cursive, but is comfortable with calligraphy, eh? Lyle sure does have some complicated problems.

name: babachewy
text: Maybe he toke those cracks about not knowing cursive seriously and did something about it.

name: semiquaver
text:
Maybe he just toked some cracks.

*will refrain from pointing out amusing misspellings in future*

name: hipjiverobot
text: Your avatar goes perfectly with this comment. Chubbies abound!

name: semiquaver
text: Sweet.  Thanks, hip jive robot!

name: shoinan
text: Your comment sounds like the closing line from a 90s sci-fi movie for kids.

name: semiquaver
text: Sweet. Thanks, hip jive robot! Now let's get back the time-blender and buzz back to the present so I can be home in time for dinner! Mom's making mini-pizzas! To the max!

name: hipjiverobot
text: Aww, don't use that hoverboard! We'll get home quicker if we use the inter-tubes!

name: semiquaver
text: Conceded.

name: mira
text:
it was Lie Bot who said that about Lyle in the first place though
not a very reliable source

name: fuckyoufriday
text: "Liquid Banjo" is such an excellent name for a serious kentucky bourbon.

name: snapdragon
text: "Taste The Twang."

name: vonpokemon
text: I'll have a Liguid Banjo and coke, please. What? You only have Pepsi? Then go fuck yourself.

name: hellofyellin
text: I knew a guy whose drink was liquid banjo and Country-Time Lemonade mix, straight up.  He'd drink a quarter of the big quart bottles, then pour the mix in and let it chill in his freezer.  Bleck.

name: molesticide
text:
that's the real definition of the word 'hooch.'

it mostly just gets tossed around a substitute for 'booze' nowadays, though.

name: senseihollywood
text: gimme a  bottle of Liquid Banjo to put next to the Cartilidge Head Pinot I've been saving

name: geysershitdick
text: Lyle is maybe the most complicated character in the entire strip.

name: hollis
text: Sometimes you just want to pretend you have your own brand of whiskey.  It doesn't need to be a thing.

name: tetrisattack
text: Alt Text: Mr. Bear tries to play chess with Todd but Todd has a cocaine problem - TOMORROW!

name: ssddr
text: Why did chris lie. That sounds fun.

name: rasalghul
text: It's like the "Next on... Arrested Development" clips.  You have to do the follow up yourself.

name: evolume
text: Morning Becomes Night

name: f1shst1ck
text: I loved when lyle wrote ray that note when they were in germany and how it looked so pretty. Such continuity

name: leahpidoptera
text:
I once knew a man much like Lyle. He couldn't have had an IQ over 85 but he could dash and flourish like nobody's business. It was like reading the script of angels.

A five in his memory.

name: quarantine
text: I really like how Lyle doesn't want anyone to know he knows calligraphy.

name: zedpower
text: He probably doesn't want himself to know he knows calligraphy.

name: dusty
text: It's not hard to imagine that he's done some tattoos in his day, that may be where he gained his steady hand.

name: gussiejives
text: I pretend to have my own brand of rye.

name: mattylite
text: It was gonna be a 2, but "...you know?" made it a 5.

name: snowman
text: Re-reading the archive for the first time, and finding that I love Lyle.  Who knew?

name: spinynorman
text: Lyle and Vlad were kings of the early days.

name: snowman
text: Truly.  I always think I don't like Lyle, but then there are strips like this...

name: meetzorp
text: Lyle's the character who hooked me on this strip.  It was Lyle's Decision-Making Flow Chart which drew me in.  It was so deeply weird, yet debauched, that I felt I needed to know more about the strip and that character in particular.  That tiger is pure id, and it is cathartic to follow his antisocial exploits!

name: lucid
text: Vlad is still a king!

name: fattypneumonia
text: Why do we always hurt the ones we love? Why Banjo? Why?! Banjo! Banjo! Banjoooooooooooooooo!
